page.title: 12PEEL TOWER IN RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: On Holcombe Hill is a well-kwown landmark called{Peel Tower}or Monument.It was named after{Robert } {Peel}because of his work in repealing the Corn Laws in 1846; he also was the founder of the Police Force in this country, as well as being Prime Minister. From the top of the tower, which is 335m. above sea-level, it is possible on a clear day to see the hills of Wales and sometimes the Isle of Man.The entrance to the tower has been closed due to it being unsafe. Local residents have compaigned for its re-opening and money has now become available and{restoration work}should be complete by August this year-1985.It is a{local custom}for people to walk to Peel Tower on{Good } {Friday. }
